title: More Than 50,000 Pissed Off Sydneysiders Crammed Into The Domain For The Climate Strike
text:
Climate Strike - a week of action to demand climate justice, from September 20 to 27 - Pedestrian Group is doubling down on content that educates and empowers you to do your bit for our planet. Click In support of the GlobalStrike - a week of action to demandjustice, from September 20 to 27 - Pedestrianis doubling down on content that educates and empowers you to do your bit for our planet. Click here to learn more about the global movement fighting for our future.

People across Australia rallied on Friday to take part in global climate strikes happening all over the world, protesting environmental inaction and general shit-housery from our elected officials.

Just around 12:00PM, Sydney was one of the first Aussie locations to kick off the rallies – and boy did they deliver.

As someone who was on the ground at The Domain, just off of Circular Quay and the city’s NSW Art Gallery, you’d be forgiven for thinking there was some sort of music festival going on. There were people walking through the middle of streets, spilling out onto the sidewalk, and a trail of police trying their best to keep everyone orderly (people were very respectful and polite to each other, which was also nice!)

Early reports say police have confirmed that at least 50,000 people packed out The Domain. Capacity is 80,000, and having been on the ground there I wouldn’t be surprised if the final figure is much closer to that.

Police have confirmed at least 50,000 people at the Sydney #climatestrike. May be more, considering capacity at The Domain is 80,000 and it was chockers. — Jenny Noyes (@jennynoise) September 20, 2019

Just take a look at some of the insane photos from the Sydney site:

The amount of people at the Sydney Climate Strike. pic.twitter.com/eLVjDKoiRx — Sebastian (@With_Sebastian) September 20, 2019

So proud Sydney. A massive turn out #ClimateStrike pic.twitter.com/rtpH08jAZ0 — Jen Ryall (@jennijenni) September 20, 2019

Incredible pictures as Australia’s gathering for the #climatestrike

This is the huge crowd building up in Sydney.

Australia is setting the standard!

Its bedtime in New York…so please share as many pictures as you can as the strikes move across Asia to Europe and Africa! pic.twitter.com/7eAPUQPq5C — Greta Thunberg (@GretaThunberg) September 20, 2019

There’s still multiple rallies going on all over Australia – with reports that over 20,000 people have already gathered in Hobart. Melbourne, I’m sure, will have an equally huge contingent.
